location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Captain Charles William Burton, Camp Bickaneer [B카k훮ner] to Colonel John Cheape Brooke, Officiating Agent to the Governor General for the State of Rajpootana [R훮jasth훮n]

mods.abstract: Letter regarding a demi-official report which had been forwarded by Colonel Brooke. The report contained translation of an extract from the Pudh Akhbar, dated 3 January 1873, and described a Fakeer, Ameer Ally Sow [Amir Ali Sow], who was living in Bickaneer and giving his family background, how he became a Fakeer and his life and travels over the previous twenty-two years.The report also covered how he earned a living in Bickaneer, recent complaints against him and gave a full physical description.The letter also refers to Eunochs that came from Delhi to Bickaneer following the Indian mutiny but who were dismissed several years previously by the Maharaja.The letter concludes by stating that Burton's enquiries have been carefully but secretly made.
